website_summaries.verdict: The Netgear Nighthawk AX8 RAX80 is a Wi-Fi 6 router that offers speedy throughput and excellent file-transfer performance.
cons: AX clients are hard to find

customer_reviews.title: Poor Connection, Choppy Performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to push a good strong WiFi signal around our house (after having just had a 1000Mbps leased line installed); it initially seemed to work OK for a few hours but then many devices were constantly being disconnected and performance was choppy at best. I gave it the benefit of the doubt and tried all sorts to no avail (including updating firmware); after a few days of extreme irritation I sent it back and replaced with a TP-Link Archer AX6000 which cost a little more but performs far better. Based on the reviews it clearly works very well for some but it didn't for me I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.author: Craig & the Mrs

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t touch this with yours
customer_reviews.text: This really is a bad router. WiFi will simply disconnect at random. There’s simply no reason or pattern as to why. I’ve tried all of the suggested support fixes, including latest and previous releases of firmware. Worse than that, Ethernet loses or forgets what’s connected and when you then start receiving messages that previously connected devices are suddenly using incorrect WiFi passwords it’s absolutely frustratingly madness! It turns out that I’m not alone, there seem to be hundreds of people reporting the same problems!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Making the impossible Possible
customer_reviews.text: The RAX200 is simply phenomenal. My old VM Hub3 gave an average download speed of 97Mbps and had dead spots around the house. The RAX200 simply provides the 220Mbps constantly all over the house. Dead spot are gone. Plus with it’s true-band services I can now watch Prime Video on three TVs without the circle of the screen pausing. Previously with the hub3 1 tV took up nearly all the broadband speed for other devices. It has made the impossible possible. And I am only on WiFi5 so it will get even better when WiFi 6 arrives in 2020.
customer_reviews.author: W. S. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: **Wait for firmware fix** A must buy for a home with smart devices
customer_reviews.text: **update** Since the recent firmware update this router is no longer functioning properly. The signal drops sporadically for wireless devices. Even disabling smart bands and the WiFi 6 function doesn't fix the issues. I would avoid till an update solves the issue. I sent mine back for a refund. **** Phenominal signal strength. Much quicker connecting to WiFi. Outperforms my sky Q mesh network. I have 25+ devices connected and none have dropped out. Also Samsung galaxy S10 range really benefit from this WiFi 6 on the router. Couldn't recommended highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Happy enough with this router so far
customer_reviews.text: My house is heavily automated and the router provided by my ISP just has not load balancing at all. I wanted a Router that could handle many wired and Wifi connections including cameras. The last router I had keep dropping devices and I had to reboot it every 1-2 days. Amazon refunded my money for the last faulty router and I purchased this router. I currently have about 70 devices wired and wifi connected to this router and it appears to be handling it very will. The wifi signal is okay nothing fantastic but Im also happy enough with it. I would recommend this router and yes it does look like something out of Star-wars.
customer_reviews.author: Colm

customer_reviews.title: Nice but didn’t work due to buggy firmware
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the looks of this router but when I got it nothing but problems. The WiFi 5ghz kept disconnecting and saying wrong WiFi password even though it was it was the right one. Tech support could not help as the firmware needs a lot of work.
customer_reviews.author: thx76uk

customer_reviews.title: How much is your sanity worth??
customer_reviews.text: Worth the cost!! There are 6 of us in a 1950s large house, all using the WiFi on multiple devices. We used to have endless stroppy teenager drama because the WiFi went down, or I would have to listen to them playing (shouting excitedly!) at their friends on Xbox because they can’t close their bedroom door for fear of losing the WiFi connection! NOT ANYMORE! It’s been a lifesaver (sanity saver!) we’ve been using it for more than a month and there hasn’t been one problem, and we now get WiFi In every room in the house and even in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! After replacing my old NETGEAR router with the RAX80 my WiFi signal and range has massively improved. My old dead spots are no longer an issue and after 5 days I have experienced zero drop outs. Even at the back of my garden I get a great signal. Setup was very easy with the nighthawk app, it detected my virgin modem and setup a connection to the internet without me having to much work. If you have a WiFi 6 compatible device like the latest iPhone or Samsung phones then performance and range is even better. Great product if you are looking to improve WiFi range and capacity and future proof your wireless network.
customer_reviews.author: Mr K Vallabhai

customer_reviews.title: Router from hell
customer_reviews.text: The RAX80 is not worth bothering with. All was working tolerably well until a recent recommended firmware update left the router unable to recognise the number and type of connection of devices connected to it. This includes not only the very flaky app that is supposed to make connection seamless but even managing settings through a web browser. I've had the router about six months now and every month or so something goes wrong that requires a reset or some other intervention. Really not a good product at all, unless you want to waste time sorting out the careless bugs that plague what is supposed to be a advanced piece of tech. Wish I hadn't wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark of Norwich

customer_reviews.title: Beast
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup with the iphone app and quick install instructions. Wipes the floor with the 'free' plus.net/BT boxes i've had. Especially moving large files over the home wireless network .. Pretty much getting full speed fibre link on mobile devices over the house (3 storey town house with nighthawk located on the middle floor). Can download a music album on the drive outside in seconds. Painful price.. but sometimes you just have to pay...
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Top quality router
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Linksys router with this one as the amount of devices on wireless was causing an issue as the previous generation WiFi 5 doesn't handle multiple WiFi connections very well but WiFi 6 does. Overall coverage is improved and now getting no issues with drop out. GUI is easy to navigate and has plenty of options and the app and to these as well. Ascetics wise this router looks the business without all the aerials that some have. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Not what it says on spec, had to return it..
customer_reviews.text: It’s bulky/big the design not so great i really dont like it. I dont have any wifi 6 devices yet but with iphone 6s i has so much issue with speed i was getting, realisability of connection and coverage.. hence I decided to keep my tplink c6 & return this..
customer_reviews.author: Sanj

customer_reviews.title: abut underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: this was an upgrade from my netgear r6250 , i was abit underwhelmed thinking it would be much better, the wifi signal is actually poorer than my older R6250 and i haven't noticed any speed/connection difference . Ok it works, and all my devices connect as expected , but it's not not all bells and whistles like advertised, seems just an ordinary router. I did howether add a wifi 6 wifi card to my laptop and the connection to that is very strong, but again, speeds of transfering files is pretty much the same as on the R6250 Ac router.. Dont expect big things from this router, its probably on the same par as a average lower priced router...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Buck

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Get a TP-Link instead. Terrible customer service, even at 4 months old they wanted to charge me $100 to look at an issue. For an expensive router it was not doing what it should - operating at lower download speeds than my provider's own hub. Netgear tried to insist that the router was fine and that the problem was with my broadband, despite my repeated explanation that the broadband was working fine with other hardware, and that the only thing not working properly was the RAX80. Then generously offered to charge me $100 if they 'fixed' it. Load of sharks. Stick with other companies such as TP-Link.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: RAX120 is 100% better than super hub 3
customer_reviews.text: After months of poor internet signal, drop outs and constant router resets, I decided a router upgrade was needed. I settled on the RAX 120 and it has not disappointed. I now have a solid connection all around the house, with the full speeds that I pay for. It was relatively easy to set up and have only used it for a week so far, so have not needed to use any technical support. It does have a large footprint, but I find it easier to live with than the constant screams of ‘this internet is so laggy’ from my two sons whilst playing xbox upstairs. It has also handled 28 connections with no difficulties so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: expensive and doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: nighthawk software particualry phone app is a waste of space . far better to log into the router directly via an Ethernet cable . big problem with the software on the router is refusing to connect to your internet . product arrived and refused to connect repeatedly confirming it did not recognize credentials . did factory reset several times and spent several hours trying to get it to connect still no joy . Ended up re- installing my old netgear R8000 router and it connected and worked instantly . Suffice to say ax12 RA120 router being returned to Amazon for a refund
customer_reviews.author: cw

customer_reviews.title: Multi-device heaven.
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of devices. Smart home stuff. Nothing fancy. Constant drops and pauses seemed to trace back to the generic router supplied by our ISP. I replaced the router with the Netgear Nighthawk AX12 and happy days! Drop-outs are no more and every little packet of bits and bytes seems to know exactly where to go and how to get there without delay. My advice would be to consider getting one if you have more than 10 devices on your network, so that’s pretty much everyone then.
customer_reviews.author: busboy

customer_reviews.title: All my friends now have this
customer_reviews.text: Wifi6 ready was a plus but getting this for a household of 5 people with multiple devices has increased the broadband speed from the device to the wifi 3X from what is was with the providers device. Security, VPN, multiple bands with one network name and wifi password is all really beneficial and super easy to use when you download the app. Think the 1 star reviews are people who possibly struggle finding the power button a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router..
customer_reviews.text: Such a great router work straight out the box plug and play job done up and running inside 5 minutes does everything I need it doesn't have is NETGEAR armour capability which is a bit of a shame as that would have been nice to have have but nonetheless amazing router.. Nighthawk app is a nice little touch so you can manage your router remotely without having to switch your PC on or if you're out and about you can connect to it that way through the app the Wi-Fi signal is astounding I get strong signal all over my property including 90% of the garden so can't fault it 👍
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: RAX120 - Exceptional Coverage
customer_reviews.text: This router is quite exceptional if achieving broad WiFi coverage is the goal. It also supports the WiFi 6 standard so making it the main router should future proof the wireless environment too. I would have preferred the software to have more features, especially when it comes to traffic management and logging etc. but I hope future updates will bring more features. Setup was a breeze and using it in conjunction with the EAX80 extender, means there is continuous and strong coverage throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Ather Beg

customer_reviews.title: Not great, good support
customer_reviews.text: Not a great product, live in a 4 bedroom house, was getting very poor coverage even with a WiFi 6 device on the opposite side of the house. Was quite difficult to setup over PPPOE, tech support did help and I got it fixed, however, WiFi coverage not great
customer_reviews.author: Joe Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Very good router, but no modem
customer_reviews.text: The router itself is impressive. However, I did not realise that it did not have a modem function. So, I have my old ISP router connected to the ADSL socket and the netgear acting as a wired access point. This seems to work well. Netgear support were helpful in suggesting an alternative arrangement of setting the old router into bridge mode. Certainly handles the 30 odd internet connected devices well and provides good range. Very fast internal networks and streaming. Lots of options for access control.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Squires

customer_reviews.title: Powerful stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Ax12 rax200 Router is easy to set up via the app but would recommend setting up enhanced features via the web site. Connected to my virgin hub3 router which you need to set to modem mode first. Virgin hub should turn red at the bottom. Now able to get full speed of 216mb up in loft room and dead spots no longer exist. Thoroughly recommend this router as more and more devices will start using WiFi 6 standard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Router requires serious fixes - logs disconnect devices automatically daily.
customer_reviews.text: Review Jan 2020 of NETGEAR Nighthawk AX4 4-Stream Wifi 6 Router (RAX40), having owned an old R7000 which is very mature and works flawlessly. This router is the opposite several devices connected / disconected from the router daily. Some devices even required rebooting!!!! Netgear get your quality sorted before releasing new products especially at your prices. Afraid i'm going to try TP-Link this time.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Firmware and support holds this product back
customer_reviews.text: Having set it up no problem, the RAX80 starting dropping streaming from Spotify (which wasn't an issue for bandwidth or internet connection). Tried reserving IP addresses, but then the TV kept freezing on a wired connection whilst all wireless connections were still working well. So tried connecting the TV wirelessly which failed. Tried a factory reset, but it remembers most settings and then tried to clear the connected devices list, which added some devices and then simply stopped updating. Several other reviews say the firmware isn't any good and I agree now. Shame, as when it was working well, it was great. I'm now out of the 90 day warranty period and getting no response from Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: William Byam-Cook

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool but not good
customer_reviews.text: It's not a cheap product. I expect it to have somewhat decent Wifi6 support. But no. I am not sure if it is the issue of the particular unit I got has some defect or in general, I got disconnected every 5-10 seconds, if there are like 5-10 devices connected. When it occurs, the SSID would disappear from the searching list. Have to reboot the router. Very unstable. I have checked online and saw people actually having this type of issue as well on Netgear's own forum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be an early adopter of new tech
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy into early WiFi 6 tech till 2020! The app set up was shocking, my devices didn’t stay connected. Believe me stay clear and go for something from Linksys, it does all you need it too plus ipv6 is easily configured.
customer_reviews.author: L.S 洛根

customer_reviews.title: What a machine
customer_reviews.text: We have had trouble with streaming in my household since there is a large number of devices. Nighthawk AX12 12-Stream Wifi 6 Router has resolved the problem. I am consistently getting 350mbps to 380mbps on virgin media broadband. Signal of the router is incredible too. We live in a large townhouse over 3 floors and the signal is strong all the way through. Everyone can stream in the house simultaneously which is great. I wish i had bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Han Randhawa

customer_reviews.title: RAX200 Junk
customer_reviews.text: RAX200 what a joke this router is. I was having slight issues with my skyQ router so thought I’d shell out and get a top of the tree all singing and dancing WiFi 6 router. All I can say is, it’s going back. The signal strength is worse than my Sky router. It constantly plays up, dropping connections, saying the password is incorrect. Sort it out netgear!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No added value
customer_reviews.text: Does not provide a better signal. range or speed than the router (Zyxel) provided by my internet provider. The speed test on the app, tests the download speed from the router and not from the wireless device. I care about the end to end speed (through the wifi). Bulky 300£ device that adds no further value.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!! I have Virgin Wi-Fi Superhub 3.0 which was useless for the number of devices I was trying to connect to it and was making Sky Q multi room drop-out every 2 days. I bought the Nighthawk and immediately all of my issues were sorted. I now have no connectivity issues, a much faster and more reliable wi-fi connection and no black-spots in the house. I even have full wi-fi coverage at the end of my garden (I had no signal there at all with Virgin). I seldom bother writing reviews but credit where credit’s due..... a simply brilliant product.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: This is a VERY fast Wifi router.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nighthawk for WiFi 6 and it does not disappoint. Initially worried, I realised I was on the 2.4Ghz network - switching to the 5G-1 got good speeds, and 5G-2 got insane speeds (600Mbps over WiFi to my Macbook Pro 16"). The wired connection is even better and I get to enjoy the full 1Gbps fiber at my house. The remote management iOS app is super simple and connects from anywhere with no config, which is a great feature and means you can do speedtests to annoy your mates in the pub. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip John Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Epic and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully future proof but certainly reliable and I used it to replace a system of Apple Airport Extreme routers that kept falling over! I used this to update from a Apple Airport Extreme router and got a great lift to performance and reliability
customer_reviews.author: Webo

customer_reviews.title: Great router, worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Having a router which is future proofed with wifi 6, as well as having the ability to take more wireless connections is great, with so many smart devices all being able to connect seamlessly and use wifi at the same time. Easy to set up. Better wifi coverage of my home than my ISP 5th gen. wifi router.
customer_reviews.author: Lee R

customer_reviews.title: Unstoppable crap
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect until I bought an extender of the same brand and same expecs to pair with my router. It was a nightmare to setup and I had to return it. Netgear have clear sign of software problems on it.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wi-if speeds.
customer_reviews.text: A Really good router. I Bought this to use on the BT Fibre 900 package as the wi-if on the BT Homehub2 just was not up to the job. Bought the Nighthawlk & getting really good wi-if speeds. A Bit expensive, but a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: The Cleaner

customer_reviews.title: System is rubbish
customer_reviews.text: After checking this out, lots of bugs on this system, icons to add for your devices don't work or lose them. Blocked sites doesn't work and remote access for app doesn't work. Why all these bugs and not being fixed. Rubbish system not worth buying. Netgear support is rubbish really waste of time
customer_reviews.author: Leo Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Great performance!
customer_reviews.text: Great router, some issues from begining with performance but after talkong to tech support works great. Cover a 75sqm 4room apartment with brick walls placed in Center average link speeds 1200 Mbps on wifi6 5ghz, not a problem streaming or kids playing all their Fortnite games etc. If not having Wifi6 appliances at home its over kill for the price. But if you have it worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that great. Still need a repeater to do the house. WPA3 fails
customer_reviews.text: Had to restart the setup process multiple times. Took 2 hours. Signal not that strong. Previous router had better range. WPA3 fails to connect to Apple devices (or visa versa). There app crashes half the time. Can’t make multiple changes to the configuration and the reboot it. QOS can’t be applied to guest only Will not refresh list of attached devices even after restore. And the devices attacked are in the house Too many other issues so I’m returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Agnes

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Simple to setup, does as it says on the box. So far seems to be really quick Everything connected to it with no problems, Including all smart devices, Just wish I could activate/deactivate the VPN from the IOS app. Then it would be 110%. But. It's really a great WiFi router. Just one gripe, My HP Envy X360 couldn't find the WiFi network, I had to upgrade the driver. Which I found really strange, Then was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Kyle G Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!! So many bugs! Even on the new Firmware
customer_reviews.text: Terrible range, only got 2.4gh on 2nd floor, same as range as standard sky router. customer support doesn’t support Mac, cannot connect to the Nighthawk A8 extender. If you can connect is only via WIFI, can’t extend over WiFi. Currently Only supports one kind of USB hard drive via USB ports. Doesn’t support G Rade. Going to see if the orbi is any better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Worse router, keeps disconnecting and heats up so much to the point it burnt out. I called up netgear and raised a case with them and got no response back. Being one of their top of the range products this is rubbish. I reported the heating up and burning out issue to netgear and heard nothing back. This is a health hazard especially if you have kids and the router is sitting low level. Save the money and buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay D

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. The box it comes in would be a better router
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt the worst router I have ever owned. Constant drop outs of internet access on both wireless and ethernet. It is not that the signal is being lost just that the router refuses to permit access to the web. I will be steering clear of Netgear for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Press

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 1 day to 1 Week.
customer_reviews.text: Great product when it works but it stops working randomly after between 1 day and 1 week. Very dissapointing. I have had Netgear products before this and have been very satisfied but this Router is not up to par. I have worked with Netgear Support and made the changes requested. Some changes helped and the failure rate dropped from once a day to once a week. But nothing fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: brenda o'connell

customer_reviews.title: netgear night hawk
customer_reviews.text: terribele does not play nice with sky broadband.keeps dropping signal constantly.very expensive for what it is.returned for refund
customer_reviews.author: k h john

customer_reviews.title: Performance was quite poor
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this however it performed poorly and would overheat and freeze the internet. I had to return this and went for a different router.
customer_reviews.author: Darius

customer_reviews.title: Anything is better than this!
customer_reviews.text: So cheap material and noisy fan! It’s too slow and it gets stuck even during initial setup.
customer_reviews.author: Behzad

customer_reviews.title: Fast and consistent
customer_reviews.text: Was so easy to set up the app was so helpful, I have 20+ devices connected and having no problems, All my handheld devices TVs and computer are all receiving a fast and consistent speed, great product highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Much better than the virgin no-so mega hub v3 that repeated and randomly blocked to devices in different rooms. Virgin hub now being capable in modem only mode.
customer_reviews.author: mr andrew cameron

customer_reviews.title: Solid bit of Kit
customer_reviews.text: Can’t fault it so far. Range is great, internet speed drop off is minimal and it can easily handle the volume of traffic in the house. Only problem I’ve had is slow WiFi in a few rooms but this is due to the fireplace and fridge/freezer being in the way which affects all routers. Ordered a netgear mesh to place in a position that’ll negate this.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: King of routers
customer_reviews.text: Impressive speeds, impressive look. I'm ready for the future.now I only have to wait for my internet provider to catch up.
customer_reviews.author: johan

customer_reviews.title: Really good Router, but you need a modem as well.
customer_reviews.text: A vast improvement on the ISP provided router. Much improved signal over the whole house. NOTE this is a router only you need a modem of the correct type as well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Store

customer_reviews.title: great speed and range
customer_reviews.text: A real improvement over previous router. great range, speed and stable connection
customer_reviews.author: leelew

customer_reviews.title: Simply avoid.
customer_reviews.text: Does not live up to it's description. Router from ISP was better. Tech support in random asain countries, could understand my issues. Returned the overpriced piece of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: It was EASY to set up, took minutes. Fantastic signal all the way to the bottom of the garden. The app has loads of features.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast reliable service.
customer_reviews.text: Signal is a lot better and getting better speeds on my isp provider Highley recommended and plenty of options to choose from to use mu mimo you need to do it from the advanced router section to enable and options to use ipv6.
customer_reviews.author: ben slack

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Really improved bad reception in my home. Easy to set up with my virgin hub.
customer_reviews.author: David Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Its a lot of money for even more. Its very very good
customer_reviews.author: The Computer Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Awful as an access point. Signals constantly dropping, lower speeds. I am returning it and buying the ex8000 again!!
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router
customer_reviews.text: Quick and simple set up. Has greatly improved my home network. Covers the whole 3 bed house and garden! So much more stable and easy to manage. Not to mention the added features are actually useful. A must buy!
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, strong coverage and fast
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and strong signal across home and garden. All my devices connect to the WiFi with no issue including Smart TVs and game consoles which were a problem when I used my previous router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speed and signal
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wifi 6 router No setup option for Express VPN at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: looks great, rubbish performance
customer_reviews.text: this product looks like something from Star wars. But for the price the performance is unacceptable with rubbish support. Connectivity is choppy at best and I get only 5 meters of range. This is rubbish for a router which costs £250+.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The WiFi doesn’t exists
customer_reviews.text: The worst router I’ve ever bought a total waste of good money. Don’t buy whatever you do. Of all the netgear stuff I’ve bought this is the worst
customer_reviews.author: jamie durdin

customer_reviews.title: Netgear router amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: This router does what it says on the tin Amazing bit of kit
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Love the AX12 RAX200
customer_reviews.text: It's a awesome product easy to setup and fast speeds and it does what it's supposed .
customer_reviews.author: zulfiqar Ali

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Had virgin media superhub got speeds of 100-150 mbs most times. Then i got this nighthawk now i constantly get 380. Improved range and speed
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: RAX80
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up Excellent product, highly recommend Great surport from Netgear Plug and Play, smart app makes setting up a doddle
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Best and most stable router I had in a number of years
customer_reviews.author: Kirill

customer_reviews.title: What a difference this makes
customer_reviews.text: What a difference this router makes to the house when we are in lock down. Thank you Netgear
customer_reviews.author: NK.

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to set up!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! Impossible to set up and is now just an ugly brick on the sideboard. Don’t bother.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Richard A Berry

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The ease of use and setup is outstanding. Wouls highly recommend this to anyone looking for a quality router.
customer_reviews.author: MR PETER ADKINS

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but it is top of its class.
customer_reviews.text: WiFi signal seems good, haven’t had much time to fully utilise it’s capability. Very powerful router
customer_reviews.author: Nathanial

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: why does it have to be so difficult to set up ?
customer_reviews.author: G Goodyear

customer_reviews.title: Poor software and app makes the product useless to me
customer_reviews.text: Poor software and app make this product poor quality returned and went with ASUS rt-ax88u
customer_reviews.author: Rossco57

customer_reviews.title: Faster stronger Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: An excellent upgrade for range and speed over most other routers
customer_reviews.author: rich everett

customer_reviews.text: Amazing router. Easy setup with my Virgin Media SH3 and the wi-fi signal and speed is super fast.

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Nighthawk 8-Stream AX8 Wifi 6 Router (RAX80) – AX6000 Wireless Speed (Up to 6 Gbps) | 2,500 sq. ft. Coverage 30+ Devices
product_meta.description:
Style Name:AX6000 WiFI 6 | 8 StreamsThe NETGEAR Nighthawk AX8 8-Stream AX6000 Wi-Fi Router (RAX80) has a 64-bit 1.8GHz quad-core processor designed to transfer multi-gigs of data with almost zero CPU load. 160MHz channel support doubles the speeds as offered by 80MHz channels to provide Gigabit speeds to compatible devices. This router is industry’s first home router with Multi-Gig internet support, achieved by aggregating two Gigabit Ethernet ports. It’s a router ready for the upcoming Multi-Gig internet wave in DOCSIS 3.1. Four high-performance hidden antennas amplify Wi-Fi signals for maximized range and coverage. Engineered to deliver up to 4 times the data capacity over previous standards, AX Wi-Fi features advanced technologies like OFDMA, 160MHz channel support and 1024 QAM to vastly improve network efficiency.

BOX CONTAINS
1 x Nighthawk AX8/8-stream AX6000 Wi-Fi Router (RAX80)
Ethernet cable
Quick start guide
Power adapter
feature_bullets: WORKS WITH ALL INTERNET PROVIDERS: Replace your existing WiFi Router (separate modem or gateway required). Compatible with any Internet Service Provider up to 2Gbps including cable, satellite, fiber, DSL and more

EASY TO SET-UP AND MANAGE: Connects to your existing cable modem and sets up and customizes in minutes with the Nighthawk app – easily manage your WiFi settings at the device and network level, test your Internet speed, view speed history and monitor data usage
USB CONNECTIONS: Share a storage drive with any connected device and create a personal cloud storage to access from anywhere using the 2 x 3.0 USB ports

ADVANCED CYBER THREAT PROTECTION: NETGEAR Armor (powered by BitDefender) is network-wide anti-virus, anti-malware, fraud/phishing/ransomware security on an unlimited # of devices and network/data protection for $69.99/year with a 30-day free trial
SMART PARENTAL CONTROLS: Pause or schedule device internet access, view site history usage, filter websites, set online time limits and more for $4.99/month with a 30-day free trial
WIRED ETHERNET PORTS: Plug in computers, game consoles, streaming players and other nearby wired devices with 5 x 1G Ethernet ports

WIFI 6 – STREAM EVERYTHING AT EPIC SPEED: Simultaneously stream uninterrupted movies, games, video calls or download/transfer files at 6Gbps WiFi speed. Works with existing and new WiFi 6 devices like iPhone 11, Galaxy Note 10 and Galaxy S10

LOADED WITH ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: Designed with a 1.8GHz quad-core processor, OFDMA, MU-MIMO, Dynamic QoS, 1024-QAM, Smart Connect for one WiFi name, Beamforming technologies and Amazon Alexa Voice Control. Supports WPA2/WPA3 wireless security protocols. Includes Guest WiFi access, DoS, Firewall, VPN and more
